title: Drawing, "View of Guaranda, Ecuador", June 8, 1857
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on green-gray wove paper
inscribed: The letter "W" is inscribed, in graphite, on many of the depicted houses; left foreground, the word "corn" is written twice in graphite; in right forground, in graphite, the partial word "mus" is written; across the bottom edge of the sheet in graphite, "Guaranda June 8th 57" and "vegetation on walls and roofs"
description:
A vilage is shown in a valley in front of mountains. In the distance is a hight mountain range. 
Verso: Graphite study (unfinished) of a mountain view.
